intro: Wahlenbergia psammophila, commonly known as the sand-loving bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, delicate blue or purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in its dry habitat. Wahlenbergia psammophila is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its bell-shaped flowers.
